boundedBuffer

Class Buffer<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • boundedBuffer.AbstractBuffer<T>
      • boundedBuffer.Buffer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of object stored in this buffer.

    public class Buffer<T>
extends AbstractBuffer<T>
    Completes the implementation of buffers in AbstractBuffer, implementing the put(Object) and get() methods.
    Version:
    February 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Semaphore criticalSection
      This semaphore is used to control access to the critical section.
      private Semaphore noOfElements
      The value of the semaphore is the number of elements currently in the buffer.
      private Semaphore noOfSpaces
      The value of the semaphore is the number of spaces currently available in the buffer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Buffer(int size)
      The constructor sets the size of the buffer, and initialises the semaphores

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Close the buffer.
      T get()
      Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be retrieved.
      boolean put(T item)
      Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be added.

      • Methods inherited from class boundedBuffer.AbstractBuffer

        getItem, isOpen, open, putItem

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • noOfSpaces

        private Semaphore noOfSpaces
        The value of the semaphore is the number of spaces currently available in the buffer. It should be impossible to add elements to the buffer when this semaphore reaches zero.

      • noOfElements

        private Semaphore noOfElements
        The value of the semaphore is the number of elements currently in the buffer. It should be impossible to take elements from the buffer when this semaphore reaches zero.

      • criticalSection

        private Semaphore criticalSection
        This semaphore is used to control access to the critical section.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Buffer

        public Buffer(int size)
        The constructor sets the size of the buffer, and initialises the semaphores
        Parameters:
        size - the size of the buffer

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public boolean put(T item)
            throws BufferError,
                   SemaphoreError
        Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be added.
        Specified by:
        put in class AbstractBuffer<T>
        Parameters:
        item - the data item to be added to the buffer
        Returns:
        true iff the put succeeded. A put might fail if the buffer has closed between the put request, and the actual put.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if it is not possible to add an item to the buffer due to an interrupted exception.
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceeds their limit. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.

      • get

        public T get()
      throws BufferError,
             SemaphoreError
        Provide protected access to the buffer to allow an item to be retrieved.
        Specified by:
        get in class AbstractBuffer<T>
        Returns:
        the data item that has been in the buffer longest or null if the retrieval failed because, e.g.., the buffer has closed.
        Throws:
        BufferError - if it was not possible to retrieve an item from the buffer due to an interrupted exception.
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceeds their limit. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws SemaphoreError
        Close the buffer.
        Overrides:
        close in class AbstractBuffer<T>
        Throws:
        SemaphoreError - if any of the semaphores exceed their limits. This exception would probably arise as a consequence of an error in the implementation of semaphores.
